int DES_ede3_cbc_md5_decrypt (  uint8_t *    des_key,
uint16_t    md5_keylen,
uint8_t *    md5_key,
uint8_t *    iv,
uint8_t *    input,
uint16_t    inputlen,
uint8_t *    output,
uint16_t *    outputlen,
uint8_t    compdigest
) 
 

3DES-CBC-MD5 Decryption This function authenticates & decrypts an inbound IPSEC packet using the 3DES-CBC and HMAC-MD5 keys provided

Parameters:
des_key  [in] 3DES decryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
md5_keylen  [in] HMAC-MD5 key length
md5_key  [in] HMAC-MD5 key
iv  Initialization vector (must be of 8 bytes in length).
input  Pointer to the IPSEC packet (i.e, points to ESP header)
inputlen  Length of IPSEC packet pointed to by input. It should include the ESP header (8 bytes) + IV (8 bytes) + PAYLOAD length + HMAC (12 bytes)
output  Pointer to the output buffer where decrypted and authenticated packet should be placed
outputlen  Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this buffer
compdigest  If this is non-zero, then the IPSEC packet is authenticated first. If the authentication succeeds, then the packet is decrypted.If this is 0, then the IPSEC packet is not authenticated. The IPSEC packet is decrypted and HMAC is placed at the end of the decrypted packet
Returns:
TDES_CBC_MD5_SUCCESS (0) TDES_CBC_MD5_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1) TDES_CBC_MD5_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)

int DES_ede3_cbc_md5_encrypt (  uint8_t *    des_key,
uint16_t    md5_keylen,
uint8_t *    md5_key,
uint8_t *    espheader,
uint8_t *    iv,
uint8_t *    input,
uint16_t    inputlen,
uint8_t *    output,
uint16_t *    outputlen
) 
 

3DES-CBC-MD5 Encryption This function creates an IPSEC outbound packet using 3DES-CBC & HMAC-MD5 keys provided

Parameters:
des_key  [in] 3DES encryption key (must be of 24 bytes in length)
md5_keylen  [in] HMAC-MD5 key length
md5_key  [in] HMAC-MD5 key
espheader  [in] Pointer to the ESP header (must be of 8 bytes in length). It is placed at the start of the output packet
iv  [in] Initialization vector(must be of 8 bytes in length). It is placed after ESP header in the output packet
input  [in] Pointer to the input payload (to be encrypted)
inputlen  [in] Length of input data (in bytes) pointed to by input parameter. The inputlen should be a multiple of DES block size. This function doesn't pad anything at the end of the input
output  [out] Pointer to the output buffer where encrypted and authenticated packet should be placed
outputlen  [in/out] Length of output buffer (in bytes). The function returns the number of bytes placed in the output buffer. If output buffer provided is too small, no operation is performed and the size of output buffer required to perform the operation is placed in this parameter
Returns:
TDES_CBC_MD5_SUCCESS (0) TDES_CBC_MD5_INVALID_ARGUMENT (-1) TDES_CBC_MD5_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL (-2)
